contest-event.event-date:
Oct. 2, 1888 D Irish Exhibition Contest (Second Contest)
Irish Exhibition Contest (Second Contest) 20 Other Irish Exhibition Contest irish-exhibition-contest-second-contest
Joan of Arc [Round]
Olympia, West Kensington, Hammersmith and Fulham, Greater London, England, UK See http://www.ibew.org.uk/misc17.htm http://www.studygroup.org.uk/Archives/25/1888%20IRISH%20EXHIBITION%20OLYMPIA.htm
"In 1888 a competition was held at the Irish Exhibition, at which the prizes were awarded thus - First day - first prize, Wyke Old Brass Band, conducted by Mr. J. Gladney; second prize, Leeds Forge Band, Mr. E. Swift; third prize, Wyke Temperance Band, Mr. E. Swift. Second day - first prize, Staleybridge Borough Band, Mr. A. Owen; Linthwaite Band; Mr. J. S. Jones; Rushden Temperance Silver Prize Band, Mr. G. F. Birkinshaw." 15 bands entered this second contest. The band to which the first prize has been awarded will perform in the Exhibition every day and evening until the end of the week. Prizes - 1st £55, 2nd £20.
Dec. 29, 2011, 5:14 p.m. May 19, 2019, 10:10 a.m.
1 Stalybridge Borough Alexander Owen
2 Rushden Windmill Band George F. Birkinshaw
3 Batley Old Benjamin Denton Jackson
Unknown Result Linthwaite Silver Band J. Sidney Jones
Unknown Result Todmorden Old Band Unknown
